Define the users that you would like to provision to uniFLOW Online by choosing the desired values in **Scope** in the **Settings** section.\n+1. Define the users and/or groups that you would like to provision to uniFLOW Online by choosing the desired values in **Scope** in the **Settings** section.\n \n \t![Screenshot of Provisioning Scope.](common/provisioning-scope.png)\n \n 1. When you're ready to provision, select **Save**.\n \n \t![Screenshot of Saving Provisioning Configuration.](common/provisioning-configuration-save.png)\n \n-This operation starts the initial synchronization cycle of all users defined in **Scope** in the **Settings** section. The initial cycle takes longer to perform than subsequent cycles, which occur approximately every 40 minutes as long as the Microsoft Entra provisioning service is running. \n+This operation starts the initial synchronization cycle of all users and groups defined in **Scope** in the **Settings** section. The initial cycle takes longer to perform than subsequent cycles, which occur approximately every 40 minutes as long as the Microsoft Entra provisioning service is running. \n \n ## Step 6: Monitor your deployment\n " }. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit modifies a Markdown document detailing the setup for uniFLOW Online provisioning. The changes involve slightly rephrasing sentences to clarify that both users *and/or* groups can be provisioned, and that the scope setting applies to these users and groups. The primary goal is to enhance the clarity of the provisioning configuration instructions.
